文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: Zirconium and zirconium alloys provide the best combination of metallurgical and mechanical properties for light and heavy water nuclear reactor fuel cladding and for the primary steam generation equipment.

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: Zirconium has good corrosion resistance to high temperature, high pressure water and steam, good mechanical strength and ductility, and a low thermal neutron cross section.
介质: high temperature, high pressure water and steam

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: TRR reactor vessel (calandria) is constructed entirely of zirconium alloy (ASTM Grade RA-1)

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: The calandria is a 9000 lb cylindrical vessel, having its axis vertical. The vessel is 106-in. diameter (inside) and approximately 129-in. high

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: The calandria is a weldment of reactor grade zirconium alloy purchased in compliance with American Society for Testing and Materials (ASTM) Specification for Zirconium and Zirconium Alloy Ingots for Nuclear Application (B 350-67), Specification for Hot-Rolled and Cold-Finished Zirconium and Zirconium Alloy Bars, Rod, and Wire for Nuclear Application (B 351-67), Specification for Zirconium and Zirconium Alloy Sheet, Strip, and Plate for Nuclear Applications (B 352-67), and Specification for Zirconium and Zirconium Alloy Forgings and Extrusions for Nuclear Application (B 356-67).

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_004_chunk2
证据片段: Zirconium has for several years been used in such non-nuclear applications as chemical processing plants. The complete range of processing equipment has been manufactured from zirconium such as condenser towers, reactor vessels, pumps, valves, and piping. This equipment has been used in the processing of corrosive media at temperatures ranging up to 700°F (371°C) which is the useful range of zirconium in atmosphere.
